titles.title: Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005

A bill to allow the psychiatric or psychological examinations required under chapter 313 of title 18, United States Code, relating to offenders with mental disease or defect, to be conducted by a clinical social worker.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/24/2005--Introduced. Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005 - Amends the Federal criminal code to allow the psychiatric or psychological examinations required for the determination of mental capacity to stand trial and the determination of the existence of insanity at the time of an offense to be conducted by clinical social workers.
